rationale: The agent's implementation has several critical differences from ground truth: (1) Uses wrong setting key 'cluster.routing.allocation.allocator.type' instead of 'cluster.routing.allocation.type', (2) Uses inline if-else logic in configure() instead of extracting to a dedicated loadShardsAllocator() method that's called in constructor, (3) Uses different type keys 'even_shard_count' vs ground truth 'even_shard', (4) Uses manual Class.forName() instead of settings.getAsClass() with package prefix and suffix, (5) Missing all three static final constants (EVEN_SHARD_COUNT_ALLOCATOR_KEY, BALANCED_ALLOCATOR_KEY, TYPE_KEY), (6) Missing null check pattern from ground truth, (7) Completely missing the test file ShardsAllocatorModuleTests.java with 75 lines of comprehensive tests, (8) Added extensive unsolicited documentation to config/elasticsearch.yml (33 lines of comments about allocator configuration) when task only asked to make it configurable through settings. The architectural pattern differs significantly - ground truth separates concerns with a dedicated method and constants, while agent embeds logic inline. The missing test file is a major completeness issue.
